data.title: WHAT A HUGE DISAPPOINTMENT!
data.text:
I was excited to finally get to dine at RX, a restaurant I had heard good things about.  We met friends to celebrate a birthday during last Sunday for Brunch.  I, along with everyone else in my party, were highly disappointed with the awful menu selections.  I was told I could not substitute grits for any other food item.

I understood RX to be healthy green ingredients and the menu we were given had zero plant based items on the menu.  All in all it was an utter shame, total letdown and we all agreed we will never return.

data.title: Wilmington's BEST restaurant!!!
data.text:
Let me just say the food is the best quality, so is the staff!!! The atmosphere is intimate and always new artwork to enjoy.  I can honestly say I've tried so many different things they offer (menu changes with what's fresh and in season) and I'm never disappointed!! My palate LOVES this place!!!
Foodie Heaven!! 
Must try the "pig ears" I'm not kidding!!!
This is a great place for friends, family, date or just solo!! 
Don't forget to get a great cocktail.... bartender/mixologist knows how to do it right!!!

data.title: Wow
data.text: New favorite in ILM.  Happy explosion of tastes from Pork Ear, Duck Leg and various accoutrements that surrounded these fine plates.  Not sure why it took me so long to discover this place.  RX has the prescription for your ailing taste buds.  Great service from Christa as well.

data.title: Sunday brunch
data.text: Delicious coffee, fresh squeezed orange juice, tiny buttery biscuits, perfectly cooked Montecristo and French toast. Their staff was friendly and kind.

data.title: Wilmington's best
data.text: Even though we live in the Raleigh NC area we come to Wilmington often and have eaten at many of their finest restaurants over the years.  Rx is my favorite of all. The kale Caesar salad with a chicken fried egg was incredible as was the striped bass with butternut squash risotto. My husband had the duck breast with sweet potato and bacon hash. It also was fabulous. I had a wonderful  cocktail to start made with Tito's vodka that tasted like a chilled  spiced apple cider. My husband and I shared a sweet potato creme brulee for dessert. Can't wait to go back!

data.title: Great food
data.text: My nephew, a transplant from NYC and a true foodie, recommended this as his favorite restaurant.  We LOVE Husk and all things Sean Brock-this chef worked with Sean.  Excellent food, excellent service-the bartender even wrote down his butternut Old Fashioned recipe for me- excellent food.  Oh, did I say that already?  Making another visit just to eat here again

data.title: Great find
data.text:
One would never expect to find such a restaurant in the area. But find we did.
Menu changes daily,  so never the same experience twice.
Husband had pork shoulder and I had the pasta entree. 
All ingredients were ultra fresh and well prepared. 
Sara, our waitress was a true professional. When asked a question, she did not hesitate to say she would find out the answer if unsure.
Definitely worth a visit. 
We will be back.

data.title: One of the best restaurants in Wilmington
data.text:
On the basis of our recent visit, I would rate this among the top 8-10 restaurants in Wilmington.  
We went on a Tuesday, when glasses of wine were half-price.  And they have some good choices, at around $10/glass -- or around $5 for us:  a Fabre Rose from Provence, a Malbec, and a Russian River Chardonnay were what we ordered.  (Plus a Cardinal gin martini, with the coolest [longest] twist I've ever seen.)
The four of us split a charcuterie platter -- enough for four, and as one of us said, they take their meats very seriously here.  Highly recommended.  The restaurant has a very much North Carolina flavor, and a lot of farm-to-table items:  we ranged from a delicious shrimp and grits (even though he who ordered it does not like tomatoes or okra!) and a mushroom risotto to a Sirloin and a Heritage pork chop (my choice:  perfectly cooked, so quite moist, with succotash, which I normally avoid but which here was delicious, with corn and field peas -- nothing like the canned succotash I was forced to eat as a child).
We were too full for desert.
Total for four (two drinks each), including tax, before tip, was $176.
What I like about Rx, and about Catch, a predominantly fish restaurant, are that they are self-consciously local in their menus and food sourcing and they prepare the food excellently.  Too many Wilmington restaurants have a kind of restaurant formula that lacks authenticity (and is not prepared with as much imagination and flair).  Manna, Petit Bistro, and Bento Box are my five favorites:  all different from each other, and all committed to (their own) distinctive style

data.title: A great location in downtown Wilmington!
data.text:
My husband and I received a recommendation to this restaurant during our 4th of July weekend. We walked in and loved the ambiance. The staff is very friendly! Had a drink at the bar prior to dinner. Their drink menu is excellent. The bartender was everything you could ask for, pleasant, engaging and knowledgeable. After being seated, Rick waited on us. He is an outstanding waiter! He knows the menu and can give you background on every item. We started with the charcuterie appetizer. It was money. You would have to go to New Orleans to find something that could rival it. Main course was the same. The food came out in a very timely manner and was delicious. The wine list is very nice, Rick recommended an excellent red blend. We were so impressed we decided to return here for his birthday in August.

August did not disappoint at all. We took a best friend with us. Rick waited on us again. Outstanding service! You cannot make a bad choice from their menu This restaurant is farm to table, sourcing their product from local farmers, so the menu changes daily.  Everything is delicious. I will not bore you with our meals, but you must try the pig ear appetizer and the goat cheese cheesecake! Spectacular! When we return to Wilmington; we are dining here again! Their food and ambiance is that good. These chefs match up to any you will find in Vegas, New Orleans or Honolulu.

data.title: Creativity and consistent superior service
data.text: Enjoyed third visit recently and was, once again, very impressed. Love the menu and attention to detail.

data.title: Rxcellent
data.text: The food is consistent and excellent.  Sure it's a little on the pricey side but you know that going in and if everything wasn't on-point I'd gladly tear them a new one for what's basically a small portion of meat/fish on top of some greens and beans for $28/a plate but it is.  The food is cooked and seasoned perfectly.  Every dish; every time. The staff obviously makes a lot of money here because of the price-point so that will attract the best in the field, we've had the same guy the two or three times we've been there and he's good. I wouldn't recommend an evening stroll in the surrounding 'hood afterwards but you're doing yourself a disservice if you don't try this place at least once.

data.title: Located in an eclectic neighborhood, an incredible find.
data.text: We came here without reservations just before the crowd. They were nice enough to sit us at a table for two.  Appetizers are most unusual, combos of pork and cheese, but very spicy.  The entrees were incredible, my wife said she had the best soft shell crab she ever had. I will say I had the best duck legs I have had.  Wait staff was very friendly and helpful in choosing the right dishes.   Definitely coming back again.

data.title: One of my favorite restaurants
data.text: This place is amazing. Delicious food, farm to table. Every penny well spent. Cocktails made with house made ingredients are awesome as well

data.title: Southern Food Reinvented
data.text:
Located in an old pharmacy, RX, is sure to delight the locavore. We started with the customary pimento cheese which was delicious but it came with Rx ham which was a total delight. Other standouts for the night were a crispy flounder with warm potato salad and duck with hoppin john. We had eight dishes and each was delicious. 

Dessert was good but nothing that stood out. But a shout out to the baker of the amazing coin size biscuits. They were exceptional. I would return just for them!

data.title: We were expecting something more interesting.
data.text: The food at RX was good although a bit overpriced for what you get. There was nothing wrong with the food but for the price, there are several other choices in Wilmington that i would recommend. The service was outstanding however which made up for the meal.

data.title: Made our night a lot better
data.text: After travelling from out of town for a concert that ended up being canceled, we decided to try a new place for dinner (we usually go to well reviewed Indochine).  A friend who lives in Wilmington recommended several restaurants in the downtown area, including Rx.  We chose it instead of the others because of the menu (changes daily but they post it online).  We were not disappointed!  The food was delicious and well priced.  The 2 of us split 4 shared plates/appetizers and a dessert so we could try more stuff.  It was plenty of food for us.  They also have an extensive wine list with affordable options.  The interior is clean/uncluttered but not sterile feeling.  They have a very nice bar (which is where we ate) and the staff was very attentive and helpful.  I highly recommend Rx.

data.title: Fancy Southern food
data.text: Great food, simple menu.  Have always had great service.  A little on the pricey side, but it is well worth it.  Have tried the Tile fish, the duck and the steak.  All were great with tasty sides.  Have also tried the pork belly app and the buffalo pig ears.  All I can tell you is don't knock either until you try them.  Outstanding apps on both!  Highly recommend.

data.title: Great Meal
data.text:
Had dinner with family and have to say all very impressed with food. Steak was spot on and other diners also lover theirs.
Location is about 15-20 minutes walk from downtown area past (mostly) quite historic looking buildings which was a pleasant walk and gave us an appetite, we got an uber back though.

data.title: Dinner date for To!
data.text: We absolutely loved our dinner! From appetizers to dessert!  It was the best in Wilmington!! We had a couples date and it was perfect! Although you could bring a family or big crowd in also!

data.title: Great food and atmosphere
data.text: Located in an old pharmacy, Rx has all the charm you'd want eating in historic Wilmington. With the menu changing daily you know the food is prepared with fresh ingredients and ideas.
